snippet: Sandra Glaves-Morgan, a human resources official who had complained about contracting practices, agreed to a $750,000 settlement.
abstract: New York City agrees to pay $750,000 settlement to Sandra Glaves-Morgan, black official of city's Human Resources Administration who had claimed in a lawsuit that the agency's commissioner Robert Doar and others had retaliated against her when she complained about contracting practices; settlement comes three days after Glaves-Morgan wins jury trial on her discrimination and retaliation claims, in which jury awards her $420,000 in compensatory damages.
lead_paragraph: Sandra Glaves-Morgan, a human resources official who had complained about contracting practices, agreed to a $750,000 settlement.

headline.seo: New York City Settles Lawsuit With Human Resources Official
headline.main: City Settles Lawsuit That Claimed Bias and Retaliation
